Hi @ptn・8! To deliver the largest value on PTN, we want to curate high quality, high capacity, and diverse information on the subnet. Our objective of high quality signals has been accomplished through our array of risk-adjusted returns, long lookback periods, and a suite of risk profiling penalties. With the introduction of collateral (details about how you can play around with it on testnet coming), we will also accomplish our goal of high capacity on PTN, as miners will soon be competing to compete on larger and larger portfolios. Orthogonality allows us to accomplish the final objective of diversifying the information curated on the subnet.

We will introduce a new orthogonality penalty system aimed at promoting greater diversity among miner strategies. This system is designed to reduce the risks associated with widespread strategy overlap, and instead reward originality and long term contribution to the network. By penalizing highly similar strategies, we aim to encourage miners to build unique strategies rather than copy top performers.

This penalty introduces a cosine similarity based mechanism that identifies overlapping trading behaviors using sliding windows of daily returns. Miners with similar strategies will be ranked against each other to determine the priority miner. Miners with a longer track record and larger account size will be prioritized, which we hope will incentivize miners to test new, unique strategies on PTN. We plan to integrate these penalties to the testnet on July 7, with a full integration with the mainnet on July 14. Full proposal coming soon, and as always, we welcome your feedback!

Thanks for the feedback @cxmplex [τ, ⛏] . In general, we don’t want miners copying each other as it reduces the amount of new information curated on the subnet and decreases the stability of the network. 

Instead, we want to diffuse the amount of information into each asset so a diverse set of products can be created on top of the subnet outputs. The design intention here is to bake in the philosophy “we already have a trader who does X, so we don’t need a new person for it.”. We want new miners to be able to identify holes of opportunity, and be rewarded for their unique contribution of new information. We’ll be releasing code in the next couple of days, happy to hear critiques and have a conversation about it.

@ptn・8  We've decided to change course a bit with this update. I want to take a moment to describe the new direction we’re looking to take and  our motivations for doing so. We believe that if miners aren’t able to interpret the cause/effect relationships in our incentive mechanism, it will not be successful. Internally, we've debated extensively as to the best way we might visualize orthogonality between our miners. We explored explored different heat maps, mappings between miners to show priorities, and a main dashboard page highlighting openings in the network. None of it felt intuitive or straightforward, and the penalty lent itself to complex reasoning behind different priorities in terms of miner timing, much of which would already be more explicitly managed through advances in our plagiarism detection system.

Instead of rolling out an orthogonality based system looking at cosine similarity between miners, we instead propose to break the incentive of PTN into different chunks for each asset class. In effect, all metrics, competition, and penalties will remain the same. The primary change is that our scoring function will now be run in parallel between different subgroups of assets. We plan to have a 50/50 split between crypto and fx initially, meaning that a pure crypto miner will be competing for 50% of the total asset pool purely against the returns from other crypto miners. We are currently exploring five splits: major, minor, and exotic currency pairs for fx (some information can be found here: https://www.equiti.com/sc-en/education/trading-101/major-minor-and-exotic-currency-pairs/), and btc/eth, alt coins for crypto. A preliminary prototype of the idea can be found in this PR, which will likely change before rollout: https://github.com/taoshidev/proprietary-trading-network/pull/561. We will be releasing a more thorough proposal in the coming days with visualizations and updated code- looking forward to your feedback.

Leverage limits were set on each asset based on the relative volatility, given that crypto has much higher volatility we set the leverage limits to ranges which should in theory normalize between the two. The primary motivation here is to guarantee a more even spread of information on all asset classes, such that we have more robust product offerings. Having miners select an asset class initially will also guarantee from a statistics perspective that they will continue trading on that asset, which should make it easier to build models on top of our miners

Hi @ptn・8 , we’re excited to introduce the collateral system, which will roll out in two phases to support long-term sustainability and capital accountability across the network. Under this system, miners will gain access to capital based on the amount of Theta they deposit as collateral. Initially, the cost per Theta is fixed at $175, meaning 1,429 Theta unlocks $250k in trading capital.

During V1, which launches on testnet July 14 and mainnet on July 21, all miners will trade on $250k capital, and the collateral deposited will be capped at 1,429 Theta. Miners will also be given the opportunity to choose an asset class, permanently locking it in. We highly encourage miners to deposit collateral during this transition period and familiarize themselves with the mechanics of doing so. However, during this period, it is not required that miners deposit collateral, and it will have no impact on trading performance. We will also be releasing a command line tool, the ptncli, which provides simple commands for depositing and withdrawing collateral and interacting with the subnet.

V2, launching August 4, will require all miners, including those in challenge period and in probation, to deposit collateral and choose an asset class to remain active. Miners who do not deposit sufficient collateral to cover the cost of their open positions will be unable to open new positions or increase the size of existing positions. We will increase the capacity of the network gradually in this phase by increasing the maximum allowable amount of deposited collateral by 1000 Theta weekly. We will also introduce a new scoring metric to allow miners to directly compete on their PnL, in addition to the existing risk-adjusted return metrics.

Collateral can be withdrawn at any point as long as all positions are closed. The amount returned will be proportional to the portfolio’s drawdown.

Read more about the full details about how the collateral system works here: https://docs.taoshi.io/tips/p22/, and look forward to details about the updated PnL based scoring metric in a separate proposal soon. As always, we look forward to your feedback!

Hi @oncy apologies for having two PRs open, I agree.

1. We are going to limit miners to one asset class, if not with this update then shortly after. We will likely give miners a period of one to two weeks to select an asset class before it becomes permanent and future transactions on other asset classes are blocked.
2. The current proposal simply limits the emissions on higher margin assets, as copy trading against them has less utility for end users if their margin is consumed.
3. We don't currently have a proposal for pairs trading between crypto and other assets. This is an interesting idea, perhaps we could have a separate pair which is hedged against the dollar. If you have any suggestions we're welcome to hear them. Miners selecting a single asset helps improve the model creation process as we have a future guarantee their interactions will only be within a single asset class, ideally we can maintain this while keeping expression through pairs trading.

In practice, how can we actually implement emission caps on different assets? It seems very difficult to find a reasonable approach. Simply splitting the ledger feels too crude and arbitrary, and would create a lot of issues.

For example, suppose a miner currently only trades BTC and has received emissions from major class. If they lose money on alts, will that affect their earnings from BTC? If it does, how should they be penalized? Their earnings from alts are already zero. If it doesn’t, is this essentially a free try?

Especially considering that miners have already been trading for some time, I believe there will be many unforeseen problems.

If a miner trades BTC well over time (demonstrated by historical consistency), they would be contributing a strong signal towards any BTC strategies. Miners will still face portfolio level penalties, meaning their alt positions will still be counted against their overall drawdown threshold which may subject them to elimination. Additionally, they won't be able to receive full emissions from the crypto class unless they're competitive in each subcategory, so their overall emission would be restricted to just the major class.

Additionally, with our upcoming introduction of collateral, miner high watermark portfolio level drawdown will be used to determine the collateral return upon withdrawal from the miner, meaning that losses on alts would directly limit their ability to recover their full collateral.

Hi @ptn・8 , we’re excited to announce that the collateral contract has been deployed on both mainnet and testnet! We have also developed a new tool, `ptncli`, to facilitate Theta deposits and interactions with the collateral smart contract. During this initial V1 phase of mainnet deployment, collateral deposits are fully optional, and there is no requirement to deposit collateral, and no slashing. However miners are still encouraged to interact with and familiarize themselves with the system! All funds deposited are eligible for withdrawal, regardless of miner performance or elimination status. During V1, collateral deposited is capped at 50 Theta. Once V2 is rolled out in August, collateral deposits will become mandatory in order to continue participating on the network.

Please note that ptncli is still under active development, and we are continuously improving the experience and adding functionality. As always, we look forward to your feedback!

Documentation on ptncli usage can be found on our docs page here: https://docs.taoshi.io/ptn/collateral/ptncli/
Read more about collateral here: https://docs.taoshi.io/ptn/collateral/overview/

There are a few things that are still unclear to me on how they will work (which is why I was hoping the code will help but i failed):
- on v1 transition period P22 reads: This phase will be risk-free for miners; all miners will have access to 250K capital, regardless of their deposited collateral.  -> *how is this 250K capital accessed? The way we currently work in the miners there's no absolute capital value. P22 reads:  With the introduction of V2, collateral requirements will be enforced for all new and existing miners, including those currently in challenge period or probation. A miner will be required to deposit enough theta in collateral to cover the size of their open positions.  and: The capacity of the network will also increase in V2, and the maximum collateral cap will increase by 1000 Theta each week, enabling miners to unlock up to an additional $175k of capital per week. -> *again how is this collataral linked to the positions? This will be released along with the update for collateral V2 where miners will be able to adjust account sizes via submitted collateral. 

The proposed scoring weights are **30% for the PnL-based metric** and a combined 70% weight for the existing risk-adjusted metrics. Miners will be incentivized to maintain high performance while increasing their account sizes.

A more detailed description of the metric is available here: https://docs.taoshi.io/tips/p24/

Hi @ptn・8, we’re aware that the recent shift to asset-based subcategories in scoring has impacted the ranking and performance visibility of many miners. In particular, some miners may appear to be underperforming relative to their returns due to how they have historically participated in specific asset subcategories. We want to acknowledge these pains and assure you that we’re actively working toward a stable long-term scoring framework that fairly reflects performance across asset subclasses.

In the meantime, we’re implementing a few immediate changes to support a smoother transition. First, we’re extending the probation and challenge period up to 70 days, giving every miner more time to adapt to the new system. Additionally, we’re expanding the main competition to include the top 15 miners from each asset class, FX and crypto, bringing the total from 25 to 30 participants. Lastly, we’ll be updating the minimum number of days required to receive a score in a subcategory so that it scales with the number of active participants. This means miners entering new subcategories can begin receiving scores and incentives sooner, potentially in as little as one week depending on activity in a particular subcategory.

Thank you for your continued participation and feedback as we refine the protocol!

All transactions for collateral will go to validators using signed extrensics, with our Taoshi validator as the admin. These signed extrinsics will permit the validator to interact with the contract on behalf of the miner. Deposit for example (found here: https://github.com/taoshidev/collateral_sdk/blob/05e0491da9d978084555ca107eacd2f205e9742b/src/collateral_sdk/collateral.py#L272) deposits alpha into the collateral vault, and makes note of the current collateral for the miner in the collateral contract ledger found here: https://github.com/taoshidev/collateral_contract/blob/main/contracts/Collateral.sol. Upon withdraw, the slashing amount is determined based on the pnl drawdown of the miner with a representative portion of their collateral slashed based on their drawdown. For example, if I submit 1k USD of collateral and I have a 5% MDD, I will receive back half of my initial collateral, with the other half slashed and tracked on the collateral contract here: https://github.com/taoshidev/collateral_contract/blob/c0d38e6b562d2c9a3c565b309f2d5ae498d6299f/contracts/Collateral.sol#L54. Miners will be able to audit transactions by tracking the collateral hotkey (vault hotkey can be tracked here: https://taostats.io/account/5DPBxaTm4ntQRSKS1ymdU5ai8bmPE1zzRAdYwr9MFtQaHSks) or by tracking information on the contract here: https://evm.taostats.io/address/0xdb2e064f877b27Fcc83fb0DE98e718785aEdd072.

With the current capacity per theta (CPT) of $175USD equivalent per theta collateralized, an account with 60 theta collateralized would have an effective trading volume of about $10.5k USD, and that will grow to $52.5k USD effectively by the end of the week. By default, miners will have $5k USD equivalent on their account even if they don’t deposit theta, with the rationale being that they have already paid a registration fee.

1. Yes the audit will cover the python interactions with the vault in ptn and the collateral_sdk. Please feel free to DM me if you have any specific concerns about interacting with the vault that we can address!

@oncy 2. The withdrawn funds should be computed for the following scenario: if a miner has $1000 in collateral and a 2% MDD, they would be permitted to collect one half of the proportion to 10% ($200 slash would be the representative proportion to $1000 for 2% relative to 10%, so they could collect $800 + 50%*200 = $900). If they change the account size, the effective max drawdown should change based on the new account size, but the slashing quantity would stay the same. For example, if the miner increases to $1,000- then they would still be down $20 from their prior 2% MDD, which would now represent a 0.2% MDD for calculating their slash withdraw. Thus if they withdraw right after, they will still be slashed an effective $100 based on their current 0.2%MDD on a $1000 account size.

the competition is different so therefore the layout is different. 

1. You're competing for ~$12M in annualized rewards (as of now) and anyone can get those rewards and run multiple miners. No prop firm allows this kind of upside. In exchange, miners need to put down more in collateral and capacity to compete.

2. We're not looking for thousands of entrants like prop firms who are B-booking their users and profiting off of them. We want serious traders as we're essentially A-booking all top miners, and theres a level of seriousness when you have something more substantial at risk. 

3. Based on current capacity per theta (CPT), and current price of alpha you're essentially trading on 32x leverage of your potential slashed collateral. However, accounting for the capacity in the pool currently and the rewards, you're actually trading on closer to 200x. As we expect our miners to trade with risk adjusted returns in mind, we think of our miners as mini hedge funds trading on millions in capacity. Based on 1% monthly net return from a miner with proper risk adjusted returns (this would be a top 10-15% performer globally as a hedge fund) this would take $100M in capacity to reach $12M in rewards. We are currently at a total of $16M in capacity, so as of now your capacity is doing more for you based on the size of the total capacity pool.

4. You'll be able to raise collateral directly from within the ecosystem through InfiniteQuant (IQ). We understand, not everyone has access to thousands of alpha tokens. IQ will allow you to raise collateral from investors who will back you just like a hedge fund. In return, they receive a portion of your emissions. This will be a marketplace IQ is releasing.

5. If the cost basis to start is too high I recommend starting through IQ and their phased approach where you can get initial funding.

owning alpha is owning part of a decentralized prop firm. This means you benefit from both miner failures and miner successes. The failures end in burning of their slashed collateral. The successes end in returns for users on Glitch where the revenue from users funnels back to the alpha token.

We've just merged an important update  that re-introduces a transaction fee for crypto trades.

  What's New:
  - Transaction Fee: A 0.1% transaction fee applied to crypto pairs only, multiplied by the leverage of each order
  - Example: A 2x leverage BTC order now incurs a 0.2% spread fee (0.1% × 2)
  - Retroactive: This change applies to all historical crypto trades to ensure consistency

  Why This Matters:
 - By adding this fee to our crypto pairs, we're making PTN signals even more valuable and realistic for real-world application. This mirrors what traders actually experience when entering and exiting positions on exchanges. This fee was inadvertently removed a few months ago 

  Technical Details:
  - Only affects crypto pairs (BTC/USD, ETH/USD, etc.)
  - Forex pairs remain unchanged

This joins our existing fee structure of carry fees (overnight holding costs) and slippage to create the most realistic trading simulation in the Bittensor ecosystem. More info https://github.com/taoshidev/proprietary-trading-network/blob/main/docs/miner.md

For Miners:
Your strategies should account for this transaction cost when trading crypto pairs. The best miners will adapt their approaches to remain profitable even with real-world trading costs factored in.

@ptn・8 I want to give plenty of advance notice. We're going to be moving to paying out miners directly on their profits on a monthly basis as long as you maintain minimum thresholds for risk adjusted metrics. This means we’ll use your profits from the previous month to payout at the beginning of the next month via a debt ledger. Once all debts have been paid we’ll burn the excess emissions until the next month.

You can directly deposit more alpha as collateral to increase your trading size via ptncli, and also InfiniteQuant will be opening a marketplace allowing alpha holders to fund miners for a % take of their emissions. These will be contracts agreed to by both parties in IQ. Taoshi will support miners, using its ownership emissions to fund miners via IQ to allow you to scale your account sizes.

Simultaneously, Taoshi will be raising funds to copy trade all miners out of challenge via Glitch. We’ll be buying back alpha with the profits. With this if all miners sell the emissions monthly it will be offset with our buying.

We’ll be able to use a multiplier on miner AUM to sell excess capacity to users on Glitch. This revenue from subscriptions can be used to buyback alpha, pushing positive net flows. 

Our goal will be to get the network to receive 100% of rewards with equivalent AUM, meaning no burn. This will allow us to further scale Glitch via user subscriptions as we’re about to rollout to US customers.

Please let me know if you have questions and we’ll have more information in a proposal soon.

repeating again because Im having some DMs with some miners and there's some confusion. Miners will **have** to put down more collateral to increase their capacity. For every alpha deposited its $175 in trading capacity. You will no longer get paid out emissions on risked adjusted profile, you will be paid out on the profits from your trading capacity. 

for a $1M account its 5,714.28 alpha. 
for a $2.5M account its 14,285.71 alpha.

These offers will be something like 500 alpha for 5% take on your profits, just like a prop firm would run. We'll run these offers every month for mainnet traders. **However, don't expect us to get you to $1M+ trading capacity just from our offers. ** Other investors in the ecosystem (holders of SN8) can also participate giving you offers on IQ, or you can put down your own collateral.

It will get expensive to trade on mainnet and many talented traders don't have that kind of funding. We've planned for that. We'll be running separate funding challenges via InfiniteQuant where you can work your way to getting funded to trade on mainnet with payouts along the way. With this design, the alpha token will appreciate. Any other model simply wouldn’t work. This framework mirrors how professional prop firms operate, emphasizing capital efficiency as a core principle.

The collateral a miner holds functions like the deposit or evaluation fee required by traditional prop firms. The 90-day evaluation window is also standard industry practice. However, PTN offers a major advantage as miners can scale up to $2.5 million in capacity, with plans to expand that ceiling over time. No other transparent prop firm (an oxymoron considering none are transparent) provides scaling to this level.

For comparison, FTMO, the most prominent prop firm, caps funding at $400k. Unlike traditional firms that are often plagued by shady manipulation and predatory practices designed to collect deposit fees, we have none of that.

Capital scaling is managed by us based on miner performance evaluations. Just like in prop firms, we deploy collateral to scale miners who demonstrate consistent results, in exchange for a portion of alpha emissions (profit). This allows top performers to grow their funding with nothing at risk beyond their initial deposit, which is only subject to drawdown. Initially, this process will be manually reviewed, but it will become automated over time.

Miners who prefer to scale independently can deposit additional capital at their discretion. However, our evaluation-based scaling remains available to those who qualify.

If a miner isn’t interested in accessing capital, this isn’t the right platform for them. There’s a reason firms like FTMO open over one million trading accounts annually. Traders want a clear, structured path to scale.

to expand a bit, our plans are to get to the point of directly competing with FTMO with cheaper fees. We are planning on working with InfiniteQuant to build a pipeline to allow access to initial funding on lower capital ($100k) in a centralized manner. The traders will then be monitored for a quarter, qualifying traders will be funded directly onto mainnet. 

It will look something like this:

1. Register on IQ with a $200 fee
2. Pass trading challenge to get funded on $100k
3. Be paid on $100k account profits while we qualify you for mainnet
4. Transition trader to mainnet on $400k account with stipend 

this means hypothetically someone with a $200 deposit could end up trading on $2.5MM which is unheard of. 

We'll use a portion of the fees from IQ to buyback and burn alpha. Again, this **will be** a centralized approach through IQ however it will allow us to directly scale and compete with FTMO to get to tens of thousands of entrants a month. We believe with this model fees alone could create positive net flows for SN8, not even including copy trading or Glitch subscription revenue.
